```{js}
$(function() {
  $(".level2").css('visibility', 'hidden');
  $(".level2").first().css('visibility', 'visible');
  $(".container-fluid").height($(".container-fluid").height() + 300);
  $(window).on('scroll', function() {
    $('h2').each(function() {
      var h2Top = $(this).offset().top - $(window).scrollTop();
      var windowHeight = $(window).height();
      if (h2Top >= 0 && h2Top <= windowHeight / 2) {
        $(this).parent('div').css('visibility', 'visible');
      } else if (h2Top > windowHeight / 2) {
        $(this).parent('div').css('visibility', 'hidden');
      }
    });
  });
})
```

## Weekly Trends: How Reel Consumption Changes Over Time
Instagram reels have become a significant source of short-form content consumption. Understanding weekly patterns can reveal shifts in audience behavior.

![Line graph showing weekly my Instagram Reel consumption trends](plot2.png)

## Genre Preferences: What Are People Watching?
The genre of a reel plays a crucial role in **engagement and retention**. Let's take a look at which categories dominate users' interest.

![Bar chart displaying my top 8 most frequently watched reel genres](plot3.png)
*This bar plot highlights the genres that appear most frequently in viewed reels, shedding light on my preferences when watching in my Instagram account.*

## User Engagement & Viewing Patterns: When & How People Interact
Instagram reels aren't just passively consumed—users engage through **likes, shares, saves, and comments**. But does engagement vary by time of day?

![Graph showing engagement patterns for Instagram reels](plot4.png)
*This visualisation merges user engagement with viewing trends across different times of the day, highlighting peak interaction periods. The presence of the N/a tab imply the thought of both me adding additional questions regarding my interactions whenever I scroll in Instagram, as well painting the picture of my most active times.*

Are **longer watching sessions** associated with **higher consumption**, or do people watch reels in short bursts? Let’s find out.

![Boxplot for Reel Count Distribution by Viewing Duration](plot1.png)
